nodes.bodyText:
This will create a new DnsDiscoveryObserver every time a retry strategy resubscribes. This is not ideal, but will work in consistent way with dnsSrvQuery.
Alternative approaches I see:

Create a DnsDiscoveryObserver when users invoke ServiceDiscoverer#discover(...). Because ARecordPublisher does not support multiple subscribers anyway, that will work fine. However, the behavior will be different from dnsSrvQuery.
Create a DnsDiscoveryObserver inside handleSubscribe0. It will require rework of dnsSrvQuery to not trigger newResolution for subsequent A queries.

For now, I trigger newResolution for subsequent A queries of SRV discoverer to keep the scope of this PR minimal and avoid changing the SRV discoverer code.
Since SRV is not the most popular use-case it should be ok to defer enhancements there.

Since we can not distinguish between a retry vs a new subscribe, so creating a new observer per subscribe makes sense to me.
Since, users control the scope of DnsServiceDiscovererObserver and association with a client, if the same observer instance needs to be shared across retries/subscribes, they can do so by returning the same observer instance from newDiscovery()?

if the same observer instance needs to be shared across retries/subscribes, they can do so by returning the same observer instance from newDiscovery()?

Correct, this is the way for users if necessary.

How should we react to exceptions from any method of the observer?
Currently, I fail the discovery publisher if newDiscovery or newResolution throws an exception. But log & ignore exceptions from resolutionFailed and resolutionCompleted methods of observer, because there we have additional logic that decides if we need to deliver a terminal now or not, and if we need to generate inactive events or not.
I think we can say that an observer should not affect the behavior of the discovery publisher. Therefore, we can always log & ignore exceptions from the observer methods. WDYT?
Logging and ignoring keeps the control-flow simple. Since, we do not expect the observer methods to throw, this sounds reasonable.
rename the field to observer?
an observer -> a {@link DnsServiceDiscovererObserver}
Since this does not do a resolution but is a callback when a resolution starts; should we rename this to onNewQuery()?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,104 @@ +/* + * Copyright © 2020 Apple Inc. and the ServiceTalk project authors + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ +package io.servicetalk.dns.discovery.netty; + +import io.servicetalk.client.api.ServiceDiscoverer; +import io.servicetalk.client.api.ServiceDiscovererEvent; + +/** + * An observer that provides visibility into DNS + * {@link ServiceDiscoverer} built by {@link DefaultDnsServiceDiscovererBuilder}. + */ +public interface DnsServiceDiscovererObserver { + + /** + * Notifies that a new {@link ServiceDiscoverer#discover(Object) discovery} started. + * + * @param name the name of DNS record to be discovered + * @return {@link DnsDiscoveryObserver} that provides visibility into individual DNS resolutions behind the + * associated discovery + */ + DnsDiscoveryObserver newDiscovery(String name); + + /** + * An observer that provides visibility into individual DNS resolutions. + */ + interface DnsDiscoveryObserver { + + /** + * Notifies that a new DNS resolution started. + * + * @param name the name for the DNS question to + * be queried + * @return {@link DnsResolutionObserver} that provides visibility into results of the current DNS resolution + */ + DnsResolutionObserver newResolution(String name);

nodes.bodyText: I will "reserve" onNewQuery() for later, if we will need to provide more visibility into individual DNS queries during resolution. Renamed newResolution -> onNewResolution.

nodes.bodyText: Since we have resolution in the name; should we rename this to onError() and below to onSuccess()?

nodes.bodyText:
Rename to added() and below to removed()?
became* reads odd as this represents a record and became is past.

+ +import io.servicetalk.client.api.ServiceDiscoverer; +import io.servicetalk.client.api.ServiceDiscovererEvent; + +/** + * An observer that provides visibility into DNS + * {@link ServiceDiscoverer} built by {@link DefaultDnsServiceDiscovererBuilder}. + */ +public interface DnsServiceDiscovererObserver { + + /** + * Notifies that a new {@link ServiceDiscoverer#discover(Object) discovery} started. + * + * @param name the name of DNS record to be discovered + * @return {@link DnsDiscoveryObserver} that provides visibility into individual DNS resolutions behind the + * associated discovery + */ + DnsDiscoveryObserver newDiscovery(String name); + + /** + * An observer that provides visibility into individual DNS resolutions. + */ + interface DnsDiscoveryObserver { + + /** + * Notifies that a new DNS resolution started. + * + * @param name the name for the DNS question to + * be queried + * @return {@link DnsResolutionObserver} that provides visibility into results of the current DNS resolution + */ + DnsResolutionObserver newResolution(String name); + + /** + * An observer that provides visibility into DNS resolution results. + */ + interface DnsResolutionObserver { + + /** + * Notifies that the current DNS resolution failed. + * + * @param cause {@link Throwable} as a cause for the failure + */ + void resolutionFailed(Throwable cause); + + /** + * Notifies that the current DNS resolution completed successfully. + * + * @param result the {@link ResolutionResult} + */ + void resolutionCompleted(ResolutionResult result); + + /** + * Results of the current DNS resolution. + */ + interface ResolutionResult { + + /** + * Number of resolved DNS records. + * + * @return the number of resolved DNS records + */ + int resolvedRecords(); + + /** + * Minimum Time To Live (TTL) of the resolved DNS records in seconds. + * + * @return the minimum Time To Live (TTL) of the resolved DNS records in seconds + */ + int ttl(); + + /** + * Number of records that became {@link ServiceDiscovererEvent#isAvailable() active}. + * + * @return the number of records that became {@link ServiceDiscovererEvent#isAvailable() active} + */ + int becameActive();

nodes.bodyText: Also consider prefix with num

nodes.bodyText: Just make the discoveryObserver protected in the base class instead of passing back again in this method.
Instead of reiterating the events list can we have calculateDifference() method accept a BiFunction to report the numbers?
add javadocs to the protected methods
should we also add the cause as addSuppressed ?
nit: this may be just a matter of style but this is quite some odd hierarchy with all these nested interfaces (3 levels).
